intro: Thlaspi kovatsii, commonly known as the Kovatsii cabbages, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, annual or biennial herb that typically grows in rocky or arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Thlaspi kovatsii is native to regions of Central Asia and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
